page.title: 13THE ART AND CRAFTS SOCEITY
page.content: When Cranleigh Church of England School moved to a modern new site it was decided to use the attractive stone_built Schoolhouse as a centre for Art and Craft. One wing of the building is used as a pottery, another as a studio and the two centre class rooms form a large room for meetings. There is also a coffee bar which houses small exhibitions. A wide range of interests are catered for including drawing, painting, sewing, pottery, films and photography. Meetings are held regularly and many interesting outside experts and speakers are invited. Every March a great exhibition is held in the Village Hall for three days and many pictures and craft items are for sale. There are also classes in art, pottery and drama for children.
